title: 112_hr1028
content: The "Equal Access to COBRA Act of 2011" is the short title of this Act. It includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Equal Access to COBRA Act of 2011" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to qualified beneficiaries and special rules for retirees and widows. Amendments include defining domestic partners and dependent children for group health plan coverage. The "Equal Access to COBRA Act of 2011" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to qualified beneficiaries, defining domestic partners, dependent children, and special rules for certain bankruptcy proceedings. The "Equal Access to COBRA Act of 2011" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include domestic partners as qualifying events for coverage under group health plans. Notice requirements are also updated to include qualified beneficiaries aged 19 or older. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO THE EMPLOYEE RETIREMENT INCOME SECURITY ACT OF 1974. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 include changes to the definition of a qualified beneficiary and a special rule for retirees and widows. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 redefine qualified beneficiaries to include spouses, domestic partners, dependent children, and surviving spouses. Additionally, a special rule for certain bankruptcy proceedings is also amended. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 expand the definition of qualified beneficiaries to include domestic partners and surviving domestic partners. Notice requirements are also updated to include qualified beneficiaries who are age 19 or older. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act include changes regarding qualified beneficiaries and qualifying events, such as recognizing domestic partners and their dependent children under group health plans. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act now include notice requirements for qualified beneficiaries aged 19 or older, in addition to recognizing domestic partners under group health plans. The effective date for the amendments to the Public Health Service Act includes notice requirements for qualified beneficiaries aged 19 or older and recognizes domestic partners under group health plans. The amendments made by this Act will apply to plan years starting after 180 days from the enactment date, except for group health plans under collective bargaining agreements, which are exempt until the last agreement terminates or 3 years after the enactment date. Any plan amendment made under a collective bargaining agreement to comply with this Act will not be considered a termination of the agreement.
